title: As a User, I want there to be an Address section on an Employee Profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is in Employee Widget
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an employee profile
custom_expected:
THEN there will be an Address section on the employee profile
AND the section will match the provided wireframe and data discovery
AND the section will be editable in edit mode
AND addresses may be added and deleted
AND this section will work the same way it does on player profiles

Wire:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=employee_profile

title: As a user I want to see "History" instead of Player History on employee profiles
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions for viewing Employee Profile
AND user has opened the profile for an Employee who was NOT a former player
custom_steps: WHEN user views "Player History" table (and "Player History" tab)
custom_expected: THEN "Player History" table (and "Player History" tab) should just read "History".

title: Employee Profile - Viewer Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with Employee Profile Viewer Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempt to view an Employee Profile anywhere in the system
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view all employee profiles 
BUT user should not be able to make any updates

title: Employee Profile - NO Viewer Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in WITHOUT Employee Profile Viewer Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to view Employee Profiles anywhere in the system
custom_expected:
THEN users should only be able to view employees on rosters, widgets, reports, etc
BUT users should not be able to open employee profiles
AND users should not be able to make any updates

title: Employee Profile - Viewer Permissions (CEP)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Club or BOC user is logged in WITHOUT Employee Profile Permissions
BUT logged in user DOES have CEP Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to view an employee profile anywhere in the system
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to navigate to the CSP/CEP tab of an employee profile
BUT user should NOT be able to view other sections of employee profile
AND user should not be able to make any updates

title: As a user I want to create a new UEC for an Employee
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=info_and_general_layout
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Contract+Header
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Info
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions for creating an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps:
WHEN BOC user navigates to any Employee Profile
OR Club user navigates the the Employee Profile of an Employee Belonging to their org
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a "Create New" button on the Employee Profile
AND "Contracts" should be an option in the top-level dropdown
AND selecting "Contracts" should display a secondary dropdown
AND "Employee Contract" should be an option under the secondary dropdown
AND selecting "Employee Contract" from the Create New should load a new Preliminary Contract in edit mode for the relevant player/employee
AND the standard Employee header (or Player if they are not yet an Employee) should appear at the top of the Contract, as it does for Transactions/Profiles
AND the Info section should be expanded by default, and follow the wireframe and data discovery
AND the remainder of the sections should be visible in the contract, but all should be toggled to "No" and not expandable/removable with the delivery of this story
(NOTE: All action buttons and the status bar are handled in other test cases)

title: As a user I want to edit the Compensation section of a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permission for edit Employee Contract(UEC)
AND Employee has an existing Employee Contract(UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN BOC or Club clicks on Info tab on the Employee Contract(UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Compensation" expandable section that appears below the "Info" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section cannot be removed.
AND Expanding this section will display one line per non-option year contained in the contract, beginning with the Contract Start Year. 
AND The format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The Service Start and End Dates should default to whatever values are entered in the Payment Start and End Date fields. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=compensation

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Compensation

title: As a user I want to add a Signing Bonus to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract 
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN editing the Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a "Signing Bonus" expandable section that appears below the "Options" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section has a toggle that allows the user to include this section in the contract or not. By default, this is set to "No". 
AND If the toggle is set to "No", then the section is not expandable.
OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the section is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND When the section is expanded, the format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=signing_bonus

title: As a user I want to add an Incentive Bonus to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is an "Incentive Bonuses" expandable section that appears below the "Signing Bonus" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section has a toggle that allows the user to include this section in the contract or not. 
AND By default, this section is toggled to No.  
AND If the toggle is set to "No", then the section is not expandable.
OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the section is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is an "Add Clause" button present. 
AND Clicking "Add Clause" will add an Incentive Bonus clause to the contract. 
AND The format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The "Add Clause" button will remain available, and the user can continue to add incentive bonuses clauses to the contract by clicking it. 
AND Once a clause has been added, there is a trash can icon on the clause, that when clicked, removes the relevant clause from the Contract. 
AND The clause number should always start at 1 and count up from there. Ex: IB1 would be the first clause, followed by IB2 and IB3. If IB2 is deleted, then IB3 would become IB2. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=incentive_bonus

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Incentive+Bonuses

*Not Included in this story:*
  - *Required field and formatting checks*
  - *Pay Schedules*
  - *All post-approval edits*
  - *Duplicating clauses*
  - *Maximums Tables*

custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract
custom_expected:

AND Clicking this button will update the contract to contain the entered number of years in the Compensation section, as well as in all of the dropdowns for Options, Salary Escalators and Incentive Bonuses. 
AND The screen can reload if necessary - but none of the information entered prior to hitting refresh should be lost UNLESS the user is removing years and information has been entered for one of the affected years. 
AND The screen should remain in edit mode.

http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=info_and_general_layout

title: As a user I want to add an Options clause to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is an "Options" expandable section that appears below the "Info" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section has a toggle that allows the user to include this section in the contract or not. 
AND If the toggle is set to "No", then the section is not expandable.
OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the section is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND When the section is expanded, if the "Option Years" value in the Info section is set to a number greater than 0 (and the contract has been appropriately refreshed), there is an "Add Clause" button present. 
AND Clicking "Add Clause" will add an Options clause to the contract. 
AND The format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The "Add Clause" button will remain available, and the user can continue to add options clauses to the contract by clicking it. 
AND Once a clause has been added, there is a trash can icon on the clause, that when clicked, removes the relevant clause from the Contract. 
AND The clause number should always start at 1 and count up from there. Ex: OP1 would be the first clause, followed by OP2 and OP3. If OP2 is deleted, then OP3 would become OP2. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=options

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Options

*Not Included in this story:*
  - *Required field and formatting checks*
  - *Pay Schedules*
  - *All post-approval edits*

title: As a user I want to be able to edit the attachments of a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to edit an Employee Contract
AND an employee has an exiting employee contract
AND user has navigated to the Contract tab
AND click on the contract
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is an "Executed Contract" expandable section that appears below the "Comments" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section cannot be removed.
AND Expanding this section will allow the user to use the "drag and drop" area or the "Browse" button to add files to the contract. 
AND Once a file has been added, it appears in the table per the wireframe. 
AND Comments can be added to individual files. 
AND A label is required for each file attached, but the "Contract" label can only be used once. 
AND Only .pdf's should be accepted as valid files.

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new UEC as Preliminary
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permission to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a UEC in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Save" button available. 
AND Clicking the "Save" button will save the contract as it is currently entered.
AND If the contract has not yet been saved, it is assigned a status of "Preliminary". 
AND The contract should reload in View mode whenever the contract is saved in any state.

title: As a user I want to be able to cancel changes to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a UEC in Edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Cancel" button available. 
AND Clicking the "Cancel" button will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes.
AND If the user does not confirm, the blocking message is dismissed and the user is returned to the contract with their changes maintained. 
OR If the user does confirm, then, if the contract has never been saved, the user is returned to the point of entry, and the contract is completely discarded.
OR If the user does confirm, and the contract has been previously saved, if it is in a Preliminary state,  then the UEC reloads in edit mode with no changes stored. 
AND In later states, the UEC will reload in view mode with no changes stored.

title: As a user I want to see what stored language I can choose for a clause
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or LRD user is logged in with permissions to create Employee Contract
AND user is creating a employee contract
AND the user has selected a clause or covenant 
AND the user has stored a language for the selected clause or covenant
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks the Language dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN Only stored languages that are on or after their effective dates, and have not been superseded by another effective date will display as an option. (Ex: a language with an effective date of 4/3/2012 will not display if there is a story with an effective date after 4/3/2012 but before today)
AND Only stored languages that are Approved will display as an option.
AND Only stored languages that belong to either LRD or the signing Org will be displayed in the dropdown.  
AND Only one language type can be selected in each clause.
AND Each clause or covenant in a contract that allows for the use of language displays a dropdown where the user can select which type of language they would like to use for that clause. 
AND The dropdown will contain a "Custom" option along with any stored language options that are able to be used for the specific contract.
AND Only one language type can be selected in each clause.
AND Upon selecting "Custom" as the language for the clause, a WISYWIG editor will appear in the contract form. 
AND Users will be able to use the WISYWIG editor to construct custom language using basic formatting such as italics, bolding, underlining and bullet points.
AND Any formatting that will not be supported in printing should not be an option in the WISYWIG editor. 
AND If the user changes the selection from "Custom" to a stored language, if they re-select "Custom" before navigating away from the page the WISYWIG should display any previously entered data. 
AND Each clause or covenant in a contract that allows for the use of language displays a link that allows the user to navigate quickly to the stored language for that clause or covenant. 
AND When there is a stored language selected as the language for a clause, clicking the "View" link will open a new/tab window to display the stored language loaded. (this story does not include the ability to change the language you are viewing).

title: As a user I want to save a contract with custom language
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create Employee Contract
AND user is creating Employee Contract
AND the contract contains custom language
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks  Save

title: Employee Contracts - Field Personnel Viewer Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Employee Contracts Field Personnel Viewer Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with an Employee Contract
custom_expected:
THEN Club users with a Field Personnel Viewer permission can view and print all employee contracts in all states when the logged in Org matches the "Signing Org" for that employee contract AND the position of the UEC is listed in the Permissions category of "Field Personnel".
AND It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the contract. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs to.
          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. They cannot edit or change these contracts
                  2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
AND Club users with this role STILL CANNOT view ANY employee contract for other Clubs (driven by Signing Org of the UEC). The user can see other Orgs' contracts in Contract History, Advanced Search and Player History - but can not open them, and can NOT see any salary information in any of these places.
AND Even if the user has another UEC view permission, if they do not have Field Personnel Viewer or Editor, then the user can see Field Personnel contracts in Contract History, Advanced Search and Player History - but can not open it, and can NOT see any salary information in any of these places.

The user can see other Orgs' contracts in Contract History, Advanced Search and Player History - but can not open them, and can NOT see any salary information in any of these places.
AND Even if the user has another UEC view permission, if they do not have Executives Viewer or Editor, then the user can see Executives contracts in Contract History, Advanced Search and Player History - but can not open it, and can NOT see any salary information in any of these places, even if their Org is the same as the Signing Org.

Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Permissions

title: As a user I want to receive an error if this assignment will result in the assigning Org to have more than one MJ Conditioning Coaches
custom_preconds:
Business Rule #1.11: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=120636039
Error Message #16: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with submit or approve permissions for Assign/Reassign Employee tx
AND club user is attempting to submit an Assign/Reassign tx
OR BOC user is attempting to submit or approve an Assign/Reassign tx
AND Level/Employee Position chosen on the form is MJ Strength & Conditioning Coach or MJ Strength and Conditioning Assistant Coach
AND the Org the assign/reassign transaction is for already has at least 1 current employee with a position of MJ Strength & Conditioning Coach or MJ Strength & Conditioning Assistant Coach
custom_steps: WHEN User clicks "Submit" or "Approve"(BOC Only) (all places OnSubmit rules are fired)
custom_expected:
THEN system should display error Messages #16:
**"This assignment will bring the number of conditioning coaches with the club over the limit of 1"**
AND Ignore and Continue button should be available and if clicked should Ignore the error and continue with the submission/approval of the tx
AND Back button should be available and if clicked should return user to the point of entry

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Place on Ineligible List transaction for a Employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC and Club user logs in with Employee transaction permission
custom_steps: WHEN the users are viewing an an existing Place on Ineligible List transaction for an Employee
custom_expected:
THEN An Edit button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state. 
AND Clicking  Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode). 
AND  In Preliminary state, the BOC users will be able to edit all portions displayed on the form. 
AND Club cannot edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction.
AND BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions. 
AND In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. They can also update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, but they cannot edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery.
AND A Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode. 
AND Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values and reload the form in View mode.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.  
AND After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification. 
AND Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made. 
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction. 
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded into view mode, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
OR If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Ineligible+List

custom_expected:

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/8.+Place+on+Ineligible+List

See Error Message #9: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Approve on new Place on Ineligible List transaction
custom_expected:
THEN all places OnSubmit rules are fired
AND system will check if the Assignment date is before the latest approved or pending (Pending to Club, Submitted to BOC) transaction date for the player. If it is, an error will display. See Messages #3.

See Business Rule #8.06: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/8.+Place+on+Ineligible+List

See Error Message #3: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a user I want to be able to delete a Place on Ineligible List transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN the user is viewing Place on Ineligible List transaction (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary or Rejected states
custom_expected:
THEN Users that have edit permissions for the form in Preliminary and Rejected states will see a "Delete" button on the form in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
AND Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system.
**Title:** Warning
**Body:** Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? ("Form" to be replaced with transaction type)
**Hint:** This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
**Buttons:** Yes, No
AND If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction and a blue notification should be thrown.
OR If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse, reverse and suppress or suppress a Place on Ineligible List transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN the user is viewing Place on Ineligible List transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Approvers see a "Reverse" button in grey 
AND Clicking "Reverse" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules are not run. 
AND Successful reverse notification will be displayed. 
AND The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
AND Display reversed transaction in player history with Voided: in front of the transaction description. Example: Voided: Major/Minor Outright
AND Set all of the employee's fields to what they were prior to the transaction being approved.
AND Users that have permission to suppress the form will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
AND Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction. 
AND Clicking "Suppress" will suppress the transaction.
AND When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI.
AND Clicking "Reverse" or "Reverse and Suppress", will check if the current transaction is the most recent approved transaction. 
AND If the transaction is not the most recent approved transaction for the employee, then the user will receive an error message. 
**Message** "Only the player's latest approved transaction can be reversed."
AND User will ONLY have the back option. Clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the transaction.

See Reverse/Suppress Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/8.+Place+on+Ineligible+List

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to create a new Place on Ineligible List transaction for an Employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN the BOC user logs in with proper permission
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on "Create New" button on the Employee Profile
custom_expected:
THEN "Employee Transactions" is an option in the top-level dropdown (already built)
AND "Inactive List" should be an option under Employee Transactions.
AND "Place on Ineligible List" should be an option in the third level dropdown.
AND Selecting "Place on Ineligible List" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary Place on Ineligible List transaction for the same employee created within 10 days of the current date. 
AND If a preliminary transaction already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
OR If no preliminary transaction created within 10 days of the current date exists, the system will load a new Preliminary transaction.
AND Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Ineligible+List

See Wireframe: 
http://r6vcv1.axshare.com/#p=place_on_ineligible_list
